explicit

Class QuantAbstractRefine

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismComponent
      • explicit.QuantAbstractRefine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrismSTPGAbstractRefine, PTAAbstractRefine, QuantAbstractRefineExample

    public abstract class QuantAbstractRefine
extends PrismComponent
    Base class for implementing quantitative abstraction-refinement loop. Subclasses need to implement the following abstract methods:
    • initialise()
    • splitState(int, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>)
    • rebuildAbstraction(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>)
    Various settings are available. In particular, model/property type should be set with:
    • setModelType(prism.ModelType)
    • setPropertyType(explicit.QuantAbstractRefine.PropertyType)
    See other setXXX methods for further configuration options.

    The abstraction-refinement loop can then be started with abstractRefine(boolean).

      • initialise

        protected abstract void initialise()
                            throws PrismException
        Initialise: Build initial abstraction and set of target abstract states (storing in abstraction and target, respectively). Note: abstraction must respect initial states, i.e. any abstract state contains either all/no initial states.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • splitState

        protected abstract int splitState(int splitState,
                                  java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> choiceLists,
                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> rebuiltStates,
                                  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> rebuildStates)
                           throws PrismException
        Split an abstract state for refinement, based on sets of nondeterministic choices. This function should add new states to the abstract model (abstraction), update its initial states and update the target. Any information stored locally about abstract state space etc. should also be updated at this point.

        One of the new states should replace the state being split; the rest should be appended to the list of abstract states. Abstract states that need to be rebuilt (either because they are new, or because one of their successors has been split) can either be rebuilt at this point, or left until later. If the former, the state should be added to the list rebuiltStates; if the latter, it should be added to rebuildStates. The total number of new states should be returned.

        Notes:
        • The union of all the sets in #choiceLists may not cover all choices in the state to be split. This is because there may be more efficient ways to compute the remainder of the abstract state. If not, use the utility function addRemainderIntoChoiceLists(int, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>>).
        Parameters:
        splitState - State to split.
        choiceLists - Lists of nondeterministic choices defining split.
        rebuildStates - States that need rebuilding as a result should be added here.
        Returns:
        Number of states into which split (i.e. 1 denotes split failed).
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • rebuildAbstraction

      • refine

        protected void refine(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> refineStates)
               throws PrismException
        Refine a set of states.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • refineState

        protected int refineState(int refineState,
                          java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> rebuiltStates,
                          java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> rebuildStates)
                   throws PrismException
        Refine a single state, by splitting using the current refinement strategy. Adds new states to abstraction (and updates initial states), updates target states, and resizes/updates lb/ub solution vectors and 'known' set. Also keeps track of which states have been or will need to be rebuilt as a result.
        Parameters:
        refineState - State to refine.
        rebuiltStates - States that have been rebuilt as a result will be added here.
        rebuildStates - States that need rebuilding as a result will be added here.
        Returns:
        Number of states into which split (i.e. 1 denotes refinement failed).
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • addRemainderIntoChoiceLists

        public void addRemainderIntoChoiceLists(int splitState,

        Utility function to add, into the sets of choices passed to splitState(...), an additional set comprising the remainder of the nondeterministic choices.
